intro: Hamulium, commonly known as the common hamulium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas and is found in parts of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the roots are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Hamulium is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining soil stability.
